Martin Vogel's Symbol (marvosym) font is a font containing: the Euro currency symbol as defined by the European commission; Euro currency symbols in typefaces Times, Helvetica and Courier; Symbols fur structural engineering; Symbols for steel cross-sections; Astronomy signs (Sun, Moon, planets); The 12 signs of the zodiac; Scissor symbols; CE sign and others.
Provides a slightly modified version of the commands for making integrals and sums. Moreover, it provides commands to deal with derivatives an vector operators.
A package which provides access to some interesting characters of the Text Companion fonts (TS1 encoding) in math mode.

Virtual TeX fonts that can be used with the PostScript fonts distributed with Mathematica 3.0. The archives use a TDS conforming directory structure. A style file for LaTeX2e is included, that enables use of the fonts and the new symbols from LaTeX2e.

about.name: mathenv
about.caption: Defines some often useful math-mode environments.

description.abstract: The ``Equation'' environment is defined as having an optional argument used as a label. The ``MultiLine'' environment is used for long formulas that don't fit on a single line, but no ampersand mark is needed, since all lines but the first are authomatically indented by a predefined amount of space. The ``System'' environment is for grouping a set of equations with one number and with an enclosing left brace. These two environments also have an optional argument used as a label. All the above environments have a *-form, which does not generate a number.

A script to create proper math fonts for use by TeX and LaTeX using one the family of Roman types and the raw math fonts (any of the commercial MathTime, Euler, or Lucida New Math fonts). All fonts are properly scaled for compatibility with the Roman fonts.
Creates math fonts that match outline fonts (Times Palatino, and others) for typesetting math with TeX.

about.name: mathpple
about.caption: Use PostScript Palatino for typesetting maths.

description.abstract: The package defines the PostScript font family `Palatino' (ppl) as the default roman font and then uses the `mathpple' fonts for typesetting math. These virtual fonts have been created for typesetting math in a style that suits the Palatino text fonts. The AMS fonts, when used additionally, will be scaled to fit Palatino.
Extends the usage of the PostScript times fonts to the math environment.
Maths rsfs (Ralph Smith's Fancy Script) font support.
An XWindows WYSIWYG structure editor implementing stencils which define two views of a document, the on-screen view and the output view (which might be LaTeX, TeX, HTML, trof).

The Mathtime fonts have a number of characters remapped to positions different from the ones normally used by the corresponding TeX CM-fonts. For the symbol font ``operators'' the corresponding mathtime style files use the Times Roman font (often called something like: ptmr or ptmr7t or ptmrq).
Support for collapsing multiple citations into one, as customary in physics journals.

This collection of tools includes support for @, a doafter command, footnotes, mathenv for various alignment in maths, list handling, trivial maths oddments, rewrite of LaTeX's tabular and array environments, verbatim handling, and syntax diagrams.

A GNU Emacs Lisp package that implements a major mode for editing MetaFont or MetaPost sources. It provides many features commonly found in Emacs editing modes for programming languages, such as automatic indenting of source code, syntactic highlighting (a.k.a. fontification), symbol completion, as well as miscellaneous other basic editing functions adapted to the mode-specific semantics such as motion commands or commands to mark, reindent, or comment-out environments or regions.
A tool based on MetaFont for producing precise technical illustrations, creating scalable PostScript instead of bitmaps.
This LaTeX package supports the typesetting of programming language method and variable declarations. It includes an option to typeset in French.

MeX is an adaptation of Plain TeX and LaTeX209 formats to the Polish language and to the Polish printing customs. It contains a complete set of MetaFont sources of Polish fonts, hyphenation rules for the Polish language and sources of formats.

A MetaFont package including: epstomf a tiny AWK script for converting EPS files into MF lingo; and mftoeps for generating (encapsulated) PostScript files readable, e.g., by CorelDRAW!, Adobe Illustrator and Fontographer. MetaFont writes PostScript code to a LOG-file, and from the LOG-file the code can be extracted by either TeX or AWK. DOS batch files, TeX source, and AWK source are placed in the subdirectory PROGS.
Perl script to generate PostScript Type 3 fonts from MetaFont sources by processing MetaPost output.

A package of macros in TeX and MetaFont which allows a user to easily add labels to MetaFont sources (text or mathematics). Normally you can only draw in MetaFont and all labels you must write into the TeX source before (or after) inserting the picture. This package allows you to write TeX labels straight into the MetaFont source and to generate corresponding TeX source.

A package to provide something similar to `multiple master' fonts, but using MetaFont; you specify a font by a set of MetaFont parameters, and TeX makes up an mf file to generate the required font; this package is not integrated with NFSS (or MakeTeXTFM) yet fun.

about.name: mflogo
about.caption: LaTeX support for MetaFont and logo fonts.

description.abstract: LaTeX package and font definition file to access the Knuthian `logo' fonts described in `The MetaFontbook' and the MetaFont and logos in LaTeX documents. (CTAN:fonts/mflogo)
Font description files to use extra fonts like yinit and ygoth.

about.name: mfpic
about.caption: Macros which generate MetaFont code for drawing pictures.

about.name: midnight
about.caption: A set of useful macro tools.

description.abstract: A tool to convert diagrams from Frame Maker's MIF format to XFig's format, and vice versa.

about.name: miktex-axp
about.caption: A port of MiKTeX to MS-Windows-NT on the Alpha.

about.name: miktex
about.caption: A free TeX distribution for MS-Windows32.

description.abstract: A distribution of TeX and friends for MS-Windows95 and MS-Windows-NT. Features include easy installation and configuration, and full TeX and LaTeX support. MiKTeX includes a `basic' distribution which is a (useful) sub-set of the complete distribution removing pdfTeX, Computer Modern PostScript Fonts, AMS-Fonts, PostScript Fonts, MetaPost Texinfo, Makeinfo, and Web.
Part of the plain TeX graphics collection which allows the use of LaTeX's graphics, colour, and picture mode commands in plain TeX based formats.

about.name: minitoc
about.caption: Produce a table of contents for each chapter.

description.abstract: A small header for making a mirror of dvipsed files.

A Perl interface to mfpic making it possible to enter simple commands with tab separated arguments and without braces/brackets to design figures. The script produces a style file, mkpic.sty, containing one LaTeX command for each picture.
A bibliography style for the Modern Language Association's manual of style.
Support for MLTeX, the multilingual TeX extension from Michael J. Ferguson.

Two tools for working with multiple master fonts: mmafm creates an AFM by interpolating at a given point in a multiple master's design space; mminstance creates a ``normal'' PFB font by interpolating at a given point in a multiple master's design space.
Styles for the Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society.
Also includes common definitions for write/white printers, `special' information, and landscape mode.
Font metrics, and macro support in LaTeX2e, for a large set of Monotype fonts.
Obsolete name for Frankenstein. An obsolete 8+3-compliant name for frankenstein.
MonTeX provides Mongolian support for LaTeX2e (now Cyrillic, but soon also Classical Mongolian).

about.name: moredefs
about.caption: LaTeX defining, expansion, and debugging commands.

description.abstract: A LaTeX package providing numerous defining, expansion, and debugging commands for programming in LaTeX and writing LaTeX packages and classes.

A package to enhance LaTeX2e error messages by providing descriptions of the possible causes including those that may not be obvious. This style is effectively an online substitute for error lists found in the LaTeX books, although it cannot completely replace them. Only true LaTeX errors are included; TeX errors are beyond the reach of ordinary macros.

A LaTeX2e package for using font sizes up to 35.88pt, for example with the new EC fonts. New commands \HUGE and \ssmall for selecting font sizes are provided together with some options working around current LaTeX2e shortcomings in using big font sizes. The package also provides options for improving the typesetting of paragraphs (or headlines) with embedded math expressions at font sizes above 17.28pt.
A verbatim mode that can handle TABs properly, can number lines, can number lines in an included file, can produce boxed verbatims, etc.

about.name: morse
about.caption: A package for printing Morse code signs.

description.abstract: A package for defining and using patterns in MetaPost, using the Pattern Color Space available in PostScript Level 2.

A package which provides the command \mpfootnotemark, which can be used in the same way as \footnotemark. The difference between these two macros is that within minipage environments the latter uses the standard footnote marker style (defined by \thefootnote), while the new command uses the minipage footnote marker style (defined by \thempfootnote).

about.name: ms
about.caption: Various LaTeX packages by Martin Schr\"oder.

description.abstract: Various LaTeX packages by Martin Schr\"oder.
LaTeX and BibTeX style files for a respectably close approximation to APA (American Psychological Association) citation and reference style.

A package to use the MathTime and MathTimePLUS (``MathTime complete'') fonts in LaTeX2e. Everything is included, incl. (patched) font metrics, except, of course, the fonts themselves. The package cooperates with the AMS packages (amsmath, amssymb, etc.) T1 and OT1 encodings (as operators fonts!) are fully supported. It does not assume you own any other commercial (non-resident) fonts. This package has no connection with the ``mathtime'' package by Frank Mittelbach and David Carlisle, commissioned by Y&Y.

about.name: mtbe
about.caption: Examples from Mathematical TeX by Example by Arvind Borde.

description.abstract: This package allows, for example, to shift between two and one columns anywhere.

about.name: multido
about.caption: A loop facility for Generic TeX.

about.name: multirow
about.caption: Creates tabular cells spanning multiple rows.

description.abstract: Includes an option for specifying multirows with a ``natural'' column width.
A LaTeX package which automatically sets only the table of contents, list of figures and list of tables in two or more columns. The number of columns can be configured. Uses the multicol package.
Georgian fonts including the xedruli Alphabet and the Xucuri-Alphabet.

about.name: natbib
about.caption: Bibliography style with author-year and numbered references.

description.abstract: A program to convert NotaBene4 (including ancient Greek and all the symbols of logic) files to LaTeX format. With this conversion program and its utilities, you can use NotaBene for editing (seeing all the accents, the Greek chars, etc.) and, at the very final stage of document preparation, convert it to LaTeX.
Implements commands for generating footnotes marked by hands. For example, to mark a footnote by a star you can write \Footnote{*}{Footnote text}.
Various LaTeX packages written and supported by Alexander Rozhenko.

about.name: netpbm-win
about.caption: MS-Windows port of the netpbm graphics suite.

description.abstract: These are tools to convert between various graphics formats.

about.name: newalg
about.caption: Format algorithms like Cormen, Leiserson and Rivest.

description.abstract: New \include system for LaTeX. A LaTeX package providing a backwards-compatible reimplementation of \include and \includeonly. The restriction that \clearpages must surround an included file are removed, as is the restriction that \includes cannot be nested. An optional argument to \include is executed before the included file, whenever it is processed. This package is useful but may have problems and is unsupported. Newclude and includex are both attempts to provide similar features. Newclude is more ambitious, but includex is still more successful in certain ways.

For writing letters, fax, and memos, this class sets up an address book using ``wrapper'' macros. You put all the information for a person into a wrapper and then put the wrapper in a document. The class handles letterheads automatically. You place the object for the letterhead (picture, information, etc.) in a box and all sizing is set automatically.
A modified version of the theorem-style which provides generation of lists of theorems. This has been superseded by ntheorem.

about.name: niceframe
about.caption: Support for fancy framing of pages.

about.name: noindent
about.caption: A locally developed style to inhibit all indentation.

description.abstract: Produces lists of symbols using the capabilities of the MakeIndex program.

about.name: nopageno
about.caption: No page numbers in LaTeX documents.

description.abstract: LaTeX's standard styles use two page styles, one on normal pages and one on `opening' pages with \maketitle or \chapter etc. Unfortunately there is only easy access to changing one of these two so if you want something other than `plain' on the opening pages you must use \thispagestyle on each such page. The fancyhdr package does provide a more flexible interface, but if you just want an empty page style on all pages then this package will do the job.
Norwegian adaptions of the four standard BibTeX style files.

about.name: nrc
about.caption: Format of the NRC Canadian Journal of Physics.

about.name: ntemacs
about.caption: A distribution of Emacs for MS-Windows32 machines.

description.abstract: Emacs with the auctex mode installed and running miktex is perhaps the best TeX/LaTeX environment for MS-Windows32 (MS-Windows95/98 and MS-WindowsNT) bound users.
Versions of the standard LaTeX article and report classes, rewritten to reflect a more European design, by the Dutch TeX Users Group.

Enhancements for theorem-like environments: easier control of layout; proper placement of endmarks even when the environment ends with \end{enumerate} or \end{displaymath} (including support for amsmath displayed-equation environments); and support for making a list of theorems like \listoffigures.

about.name: ogonek
about.caption: Support for Polish typography and the ogonek.

description.abstract: Font information needed to load the cmmi and cmmib fonts for use to produce oldstyle numbers.

about.name: onepagem
about.caption: If the document has only one page, omit page number.

description.abstract: The page number must be produced by the usual means of \thepage. Requires two passes through to have effect.

about.name: oryia
about.caption: Typesetting the Oriya script using TeX.

about.name: os2tex
about.caption: A distribution of TeX for OS/2 Warp.

about.name: osmanian
about.caption: Osmanian fonts by Alan Stanier for writing Somali.

about.name: ot2cyr
about.caption: Macros to use the OT2 Cyrillic encoding.

description.abstract: Allows you to write ``\Level 2 {Some heading}'' instead of the usual \section stuff; the definitions of the levels can then easily be changed. There is a mechanism for shifting all levels. This makes it easy to bundle existing articles into a compilation.

about.name: overcite
about.caption: Compressed lists of superscript numerical citations.

description.abstract: The overpic environment is a cross between the LaTeX picture environment and the \includegraphics command of graphicx. The resulting picture environment has the same dimensions as the included eps graphic. LaTeX commands can be placed on the graphic at defined positions. A grid for orientation is available.
Provides two macros which can be used as building blocks for the parsing of text. For an example of their use, see the calendar package.

about.name: oxford
about.caption: A BibTeX style of citations for the humanities.

description.abstract: It implements the oxford style interpreted through the eye of a swede working in the field of the history of ideas. It is based on harvard and a heavily hacked bst-file generated with custom-bib. It currently only supports \cite[] and \cite and only in abbrevation mode.

about.name: pacioli
about.caption: Fonts designed by Fra Luca de Pacioli in 1497.

description.abstract: The font is uppercase letters together with punctuation and some analphabetics; no lowercase or digits.
A free vector-graphics program capable of creating EPS files suitable for inclusion in TeX documents.

A LaTeX package that can re-define the plain page style under the control of options, so you can have page numbers: at the top or bottom of the page; in the inside corner, outside corner, or in the middle. It was inspired by Axel Sommerfeldt's rplain package.
Selects single pages, page areas, odd, or even pages for output.

A class derived from article, tuned for producing papers for journals. Introduces new layout options and font commands for sections/parts. Defines a new keywords environment, and subtitle and institution commands for the title section. New commands for revisions. And more.
Provides enumerate and itemize environments that can be used within paragraphs and format the items either as running text or as separate paragraphs with a preceding number or symbol.
Provides a parallel environment which allows two columns of text to be typeset. Useful for typesetting two languages side-by-side.

about.name: path
about.caption: A LaTeX package to break long strings at convenient places.

description.abstract: The strings might be directory paths, email addresses, URLs, etc.

Support for the easy inclusion of graphics made by PAW (Physics Analysis Workstation). You need to have PAW installed on your system to benefit from this package. This package is now obsolete and will not be supported anymore.

about.name: pb-diagram
about.caption: A diagram package using LAMSTeX or Xy-pic fonts.

about.name: pbmtogf
about.caption: Convert pbm images to gf font files.

description.abstract: A package to convert a pbm (portable bitmap) file to a gf (font) and a pl (perl) file, effectively creating a font from the bitmap. The font can then be used in any TeX/LaTeX files.

An extension of the hyperref package to provide a screen-based document design. This package helps to generate pdf documents that are readable on screen and will fit the screen's aspect ratio. Also it can be used with various options to produce regular print versions of the same document without any extra effort.
A PDFTeX executable compiled with DJGPP v.2.01, to be used with the DJGPP v.2.01 port of web2c for MS-DOS and MS-Windows 95.
An extension of TeX which directly generates PDF documents instead of DVI. This is under development and regarded as beta software.
A package for symmetric groups, allowing you to input, output, and calculate with them.
A PostScript program for geberating missing AFM files from PFB/PFA and (optionally) PFM font files.

about.name: phoenician
about.caption: Fonts for the semitic script in use from about 1600 BC.

description.abstract: This font formed the basis for all the world's alphabets. Mirrored forms are provided for typesetting either left-to-right or right-to-left (as the Phoenicians did)

about.name: phonetic
about.caption: MetaFont Phonetic fonts, based on Computer Modern.

description.abstract: A BibTeX style derived from apalike with author names in all caps.
(NOTE: Piet van Oostrum does not recommend this package. Picins is recommended instead.)
Picture drawing macros for (\La)TeX.
MetaFont package for the Klingon language with okuda orthography.

The TDS standard specifies that pk and gf files contain \special strings to identify the contents of pk and gf files. Pkfind is a variant of the GNU find utility modified to understand those specials, and to act on them in some cases. For example, it can be used to delete all pk files created by gsftopk from a subdirectory tree.

about.name: pl-mf
about.caption: Polish extension of Computer Modern fonts in MF sources.

about.name: pl-qx
about.caption: LaTeX support for extra Polish fonts (Antyktor etc.).

description.abstract: LaTeX support for extra Polish fonts (Antyktor etc.).

about.name: pl
about.caption: Literate Programming for Prolog with LaTeX.

about.name: plainmisc
about.caption: Miscellaneous useful macros for plain TeX.

about.name: plari
about.caption: A document class for typesetting stageplay scripts.

description.abstract: Tools to typeset documents in Polish using LaTeX2e with Polish fonts (so-called PL fonts), EC fonts, and CM fonts.
A class and style file that supports the typesetting of plays, including options for line numbering.

about.name: plcalendar
about.caption: Plain macros for making nice calendars.

description.abstract: LaTeX graphics package with wrapper to allow it to be used with generic plain TeX.
Polish extension of Computer Modern fonts, PL fonts in PostScript format. Use the same tfm files as for pk fonts generated by MetaFont.

A macro package that implements many (em)TeX related features for the OS/2 EPM editor. A menu item is added to the EPM menu, a new toolbar is provided, and hotkeys for some (\La)TeX commands are defined.
A set of extensions to LaTeX picture environment, including a wider range of vectors, and a lot more box frame styles.
Page preparation for prepress, color separation, crop-marks, color and gray scale bars, booklet preparation, etc.

about.name: polish
about.caption: General TeX and LaTeX documentation in Polish.

about.name: polyglot
about.caption: A package for LaTeX2e multilingual support.

about.name: ppchtex
about.caption: A package that can be used to typeset chemical formulas.

description.abstract: The package is a separate module of the context macro package for TeX (context is a full featured, parameter driven macro package, which fully supports advanced interactive documents).

about.name: prelim2e
about.caption: Allows the marking of preliminary versions of a document.

description.abstract: Additional functionality for the LaTeX2e label--reference mechanism allowing the ``preformat'' of all types of labels. This package is compatible with hyperref and other packages.

The file `programs.sty' is intended to allow a parameterized way of typesetting programs with TeX/LaTeX commands inside. The file `keywords.sty' allows definition and use of sets of keywords that will be typeset with different fonts, according to the wish of the user.
A Perl script for compiling, previewing, and printing LaTeX documents. Derived from LatexMk version 2.0.
A PostScript program for converting one-page PostScript files into and EPS (encapsulated PostScript) files acceptable by CorelDRAW!(R), Adobe Illustrator(TM) and Fontographer(R).
A PostScript preamble providing an interactive environement for fast previewing of PostScript documents with GhostScript, enabling scaling rotation, grids, printing specified pages, on-line help etc.

about.name: psboxit
about.caption: Enables one to put a PostScript drawing behind a TeX box.

description.abstract: The drawing is parameterised by the position and the size of the TeX box.
Computes the BoundingBox of a PostScript file settin the BoundingBox comment in the file accordingly, using GhostScript, pnmfile and pnmcrop.

Intended as a replacement for psfonts of psnfss, psfont uses one file for redefining all default fonts instead of one file for each font. It also contains all parts of psfonts.dtx which are not covered by this general concept (i.e., the pifonts, mathptm and two fd-files for Adobe Symbol and Adobe Zapf Dingbats). This file is specific to PostScript fonts.

about.name: psfonts
about.caption: PostScript fonts for use with TeX and LaTeX.

description.abstract: Allows LaTeX constructions (equations, picture environments, etc.) to be precisely superimposed over Encapsulated PostScript figures, using your own favorite drawing tool to create an EPS figure and placing simple text ``tags'' where each replacement is to be placed, with PSfrag automatically removing these tags from the figure and replacing them with a user specified LaTeX construction, properly aligned, scaled, and/or rotated.

A small package that makes LaTeX default to `standard' PostScript fonts. It is basically a merger of the times and mathptm styles from the psnfss suite of packages. You must have installed standard LaTeX and the psnfss PostScript fonts to use this package. The main novel feature is that the pslatex package tries to compensate for the visual differences between the Adobe fonts by scaling Helvetica by 90\%, and `condensing' Courier (i.e. scaling horizontally) by 85\%. The package is supplied with a (unix) shell file for a `pslatex' command that allows standard LaTeX documents to be processed, without needing to edit the file.
Concatenate PostScript files as long as they have been generated by the same program (e.g., generated by dvips).
Font definition files, macros and font metrics for common PostScript fonts.
Extra styles and encodings for PS fonts, including Y&Y encoding support.
Replacement for core LaTeX picture macros to use PostScript \special commands.

about.name: pstoedit
about.caption: Translate PostScript and PDF to other formats.

description.abstract: Other formats include tgif, FrameMaker mif, XFig's fig, pdf, gnuplot, MS-Windows wmf, CAD exchange format dxf, LightWave 3D lwo, RenderMan rib, Real3D rib, Java applet, and Idraw format.

about.name: pstotext
about.caption: Extract ASCII from PostScript and PDF.

description.abstract: A free Unix program that extracts ASCII text from PostScript and PDF (Acrobat) files. pstotext uses GhostScript, but does a more careful job with kerned characters and nonstandard font encodings than Ghostscript's ps2ascii utility.

An extensive collection of PostScript macros that is compatible with most TeX macro packages, including Plain TeX, LaTeX, AMS-TeX, and AMS-LaTeX. Included are macros for color, graphics, pie charts, rotation, trees and overlays. It has many special features, including: a wide variety of graphics (picture drawing) macros, with a flexible interface and with color support. There are macros for coloring or shading the cells of tables.

Utilities for manipulating PostScript documents, including page selection and rearrangement, resizing the page, arrangement into signatures for booklet printing, and page merging for n-up printing. Utilities include psbook, psselect, pstops, psnup, psresize, epsffit.
Donald Knuth's punk font
A DOS graphics program to generates output for PicTeX and epic.
Public domain Adobe fonts including Quasi-Palladio (regular, italic, bold and bold italic), based on URW's Palladio, and Quasi-Times.
For defining systematic mnemonic abbreviations, starting with ` for math symbols and \" for arrows, from the amssymb and stmaryrd packages.
A package for creating decorative chapter headings with quotations, a PostScript output device and the psnfss package are needed, the color package and a greyscale output device are recommended.
A package to automatically translate the character \" to `` or '' so that opening and closing quotes are correctly produced.

This package decodes the german `R- und S-S\"atze', which are numerically coded security advice for chemical substances into plain text. This is, e.g., used to compose security sheets or lab protocols and especially useful for students of chemistry.
Provides any TeX format (including LaTeX) with `raggedleft' and `raggedcenter' formatting of paragraphs while maintaining full control of hyphenation and degree of raggedness.

A LaTeX package which defines new commands \Centering, \RaggedLeft, and \RaggedRight and new environments Center, FlushLeft, and FlushRight, which set ragged text and are easily configurable to allow hyphenation.
A C program and LaTeX package to draw syntax diagrams specified in EBNF.

about.name: rangecite
about.caption: Will turn a range of citations into something like [1..3].

description.abstract: Will turn a range of citations into something like [1..3].
A LaTeX2e package providing emulation of LaTeX 2.09 documents which used low-level font commands such as \tenrm.

A package for ``quick and dirty'' printing of raw (i.e., non-TeX) Russian texts by persons who do not have Russian printer fonts (but have Cyrillic TeX). It makes various symbols ``normal'' letters and converts the ``unisex'' quote character \" into Russian-style << and > > quotes.

about.name: rcs
about.caption: Use RCS (revision control system) tags in LaTeX documents.

description.abstract: Use RCS (revision control system) tags in LaTeX documents.

about.name: rcsinfo
about.caption: Support for the revision control system.

description.abstract: A package to extract RCS (Revision Control System) information and use it in a LaTeX document. For users of LaTeX2HTML rcsinfo.perl is included.

about.name: recipe
about.caption: A LaTeX2e class file to typeset recipes.

description.abstract: Intended to check references in a document, looking for numbered but unlabelled equations, for labels which are not used in the text, for unused bibliography references. It can also display label names in text near corresponding numbers of equations and/or bibliography references.
A new document class for writing technical reference manuals. It offers a wide left margin for notes to the reader, like some of the manuals distributed by Adobe.
LaTeX package providing a relaxed font encoding to make available to a font designer more slots for insertion of ligatures and accented characters.

about.name: relsize
about.caption: Set the font size relative to the current font size.

description.abstract: \@removefromreset is a companion to the standard \@addtoreset command which allows counters to be removed from the reset list of a controlling counter.
A really general loop macro, which can be nested to arbitrary depth without any grouping or such.
Provides a reverse-enumerate environment where all items are numbered in reverse order.
Includes styles for American Physical Society, American Institute of Physics, and Optical Society of America. Only works in compatibility mode under LaTeX2e.
A macro package for use with epsf.tex which allows PostScript labels in an eps file to be replaced by TeX labels.

about.name: rmpage
about.caption: A package to help change page layout parameters in LaTeX.

description.abstract: It lets you change page layout parameters in small steps over a range of values using options. It can set \textwidth appropriately for the main fount, and ensure that the text fits inside the printable area of a printer. An rmpage-formatted document can be typeset identically without rmpage after a single cut and paste operation. Local configuration can set defaults: for all documents; and by class, by printer, and by paper size. The geometry package is better if you want to set page layout parameters to particular measurements.
A LaTeX2e package for type-setting Romanian in a multi-lingual TeX environment.
A package built on the standard LaTeX graphics package to perform all the different sorts of rotation one might like, including complete figures and tables and captions.
The page numbers are now in the lower right corner.
Converted (PostScript) outlines of the rsfs fonts.

Contains MetaFont sources for fonts of uppercase script letters for use as symbols in scientific and mathematical typesetting, in contrast to the informal script fonts such as that used for the `calligraphic' symbols in the TeX math symbol font.
A collection of Russian hyphenation patterns supporting a number of Cyrillic font encodings, including T2, UCY (Omega Unicode Cyrillic), LCY, LWN (OT2), and koi8-r.
This font was used in England until just after printing was established.
The patchfile s2latex.patch provides a port to ANSI C and cleans up the Makefile.
Provides a means of expressing `typed' references (as it were) within a document.
A font and pre-processor suitable for the production of documents written in Sanskrit.
Extensions to the CM fonts, providing a parameterization scheme to build fonts at true design sizes.

A package providing font definition files (plus a replacement for the package exscale) to access many of the fonts in Sauter's (Knappen's, Holin's) collection. These fonts are available in all point sizes and look nicer for such ``intermediate'' document sizes as 11pt. The package sbbm is an alternative to access the bbm fonts, a nice collection of blackboard bold symbols.

about.name: scale
about.caption: Scale document by sqrt(2) or magstep(2).

description.abstract: A package to scale a document by sqrt(2) (or by \magstep{2}). This is useful if you are preparing a document on, for example, A5 paper and want to print on A4 paper to achieve a better resolution.
\scalefont{2} selects the current font in twice the current size. \scalefont{.75} reduces the current font size by three quarters.

A package intended to automatically format weekly schedules using LaTeX's picture environment. It requires the packages calc and color. Its main feature is the accuracy with which appointments are represented: boxes drawn to represent a particular appointment are accurate to the minute -- i.e., a 31 minute appointment will have a box 1/60th longer than a 30 minute appointment. A number of features are included to allow the user to customize the output.
A LaTeX2e package to help change the style of any or all of LaTeX's sectional headers in the article, book, or report classes. Examples include the addition of rules above or below a section title.
Eases the typesetting of notation of semantics and compilers. Includes T-diagrams, various derivation symbols and inference trees.
Produce overhead slides (transparencies) with bells and whistles.
Support for double, one-and-a-half, and other line spacings based on pt size.
Defines some commands to draw signal flow graphs as used by electrical and electronics engineers and graph theorists.
Print part/chapter/section headers with the sans-serif font of the current family in the the standard book/report/article document classes.
A tool to shade the background of any box -- text, figure, table etc. -- using Plain (\La)TeX.

Package that allows declarations of the form 
ewshadetheorem{thm}{Theorem} or 
ewshadetheorem{}[]{} or 
ewshadetheorem{}{}[] to produce shaded boxes from the usual command  egin{theorem} \ldots \end{theorem}. The color package is required.

about.name: shading
about.caption: A LaTeX Style file for putting text on a shaded background.

description.abstract: Requires a PostScript printer and dvi-file converter.
A package intended for simple documents with some Hebrew (using some words, an address, a short abstract, without fussing around with TeX--\Xet, hebrew screen fonts or keyboard encodings).

about.name: shapepar
about.caption: A macro to typeset paragraphs in specific shapes.

about.name: shhyphl
about.caption: Serbo-croat hyphenation written in the latin alphabet.

description.abstract: Provides four environments for typesetting lists of short items which may be layout horizontally as well.

A package to create another table of contents with a different depth, useful in large documents where a detailed table of contents should be accompanied by a shorter one, giving only a general overview of the main topics in the document.

A package for LaTeX providing a number of commands for printing the value of a TeX dimension. For example, \tenthpt{\baselineskip} yields the current value of \baselineskip rounded to the nearest tenth of a point.

about.name: showkeys
about.caption: Show label, ref, cite and bib keys.

about.name: showlabels
about.caption: Show label commands in the margin.

description.abstract: Defines environments called SCfigure and SCtable (analogous to figure and table) to typeset captions sideways. Options include outercaption, innercaption, leftcaption and rightcaption.
Document class for formatting papers according to the specifications for submission to the annual ACM Siggraph conference.
A set of files for typing the Tibetan language in TeX or LaTeX.
Typeset physical units following the rules of the International System of Units (SI).
Draw an oblique (slash) line in a `tabular' column in LaTeX.
Useful for the Physicist's `Feynman slashed character' notation.
A LaTeX package defining \itswitch, \slswitch, \textitswitch, and \textslswitch, which switch between slanted or italic type and upright type. Can be used to represent emphasis with slanted type.
A class package for the easy production of a slide collection with annotations. Builds on the report style (or variants).
This is a standard LaTeX2e class for the production of overhead transparencies (foils), replacing the older SliTeX format. Can be used in conjunction with lscape and fancyhdr, for example.

Support for all 4 shapes of small caps in DC1.3 where SC becomes a family, rather than a shape (\scshape is replaced by \scfamily). Thus you can write \bf\scfamily\slshape to get small caps bold slanted.
This package activates the minus sign such that it guesses whether to print as a hyphen or as minus sign in text mode (which is one of the most common typografical errors in LaTeX texts).

about.name: sober
about.caption: Reduces the amount of white space on the page.

description.abstract: Reduces the size of various skips.

Provides commands which are useful when dealing with Hilbert and Sobolev spaces (which occours very often, for example, in numerical analisys). It also provides the \Norm, \SemiNorm, \Scalar and Crochet commands which are also involved in the same context.

A programmer's toolkit package for use by package writers supporting the provision of options which switch definitions contained in a package on and off through package options. It thus does not require all of the package to be loaded into memory.

about.name: soul
about.caption: Hyphenation for letterspacing, underlining, and more.

description.abstract: Provides hyphenateable spacing out (letterspacing), underlining, striking out, etc., using the TeX hyphenation algorithm to find the proper hyphens automatically. The package also provides a mechanism that can be used to implement similar tasks, that have to treat text syllable by syllable. This is shown in two examples.
Various TeX related files for typesetting documents written in Spanish, including hyphenation and dictionaries.
Change bsphack/esphack so that it is invisible in vertical mode.

about.name: sprite
about.caption: Macros to set bitmaps with TeX.

description.abstract: LaTeX package and font definition file to access the `cmssq' fonts, i.e. Computer Modern Sans Serif Quotation Style. The LaTeX package also defines a chapterquotes environment as an example application.
A TeX format designed to help students write short reports and essays. It provides the user with a suitable set of commands for such a task. It is also more robust than plain TeX and LaTeX.

about.name: stdclsdv
about.caption: Provide sectioning information for package writers.

description.abstract: The stdclsdv package is designed for package writers who need to know what sectioning divsions are provided by the document's class. It also provides a version of \CheckCommand that sets a flag rather than printing a warning.
Converted (PostScript) outlines of the stmaryrd fonts.

about.name: stmaryrd
about.caption: St Mary Road symbols for functional programming.

description.abstract: Provides a command \textsubscript, which is copied from the command \textsuperscript that's part of LaTeX.
Generally longtable is a little easier to use and more flexible.

about.name: swiftex
about.caption: Edit doc.sty and normal LaTeX files with GNU Emacs.

description.abstract: docTeX mode is for editing buffers containing self-documenting LaTeX code that uses the doc package, including the ltxdoc document class. For these buffers, docTeX mode is significantly more useful than the alternatives provided by standard Emacs and AUC TeX. swifTeX mode is for editing buffers containing normal LaTeX files and provides an alternative to the LaTeX modes in the standard Emacs distribution and the AUC TeX package.

about.name: syngen
about.caption: A tool for generating syntax diagrams from BNF\@.

description.abstract: A tool for generating syntax diagrams from BNF\@. The diagrams use the LaTeX picture mode and can be included in any LaTeX2e document.
Implements the \syntaxonly declaration used for running a document through LaTeX without actually getting any output.
A package to typeset syntactic trees such as those used in Chomsky's Generative grammar, based on a description of the structure of the tree.
A package offering a variant of the tabbing environment which allows accented letters.
Better vertical spacing in tables and arrays (tabular lineskip).

about.name: tap
about.caption: An advanced, however easy table package.

author.name: B. Jackowski, P. Pianowski, P. Strzelczyk

description.abstract: With PostScript allows shaded/coloured tables with diagonal rules. Plain, LaTeX, etc.

about.name: tbe
about.caption: Examples from Arvind Borde's TeX by Example.

description.abstract: A package for vietnamese TCVN encoding which is widely used in MS-Windows applications.
A plugin for Netscape which allows you to view TeX and LaTeX source files in Netscape as if you were using a dvi viewer, available for MS-Windows 95/NT, Sun Solaris, SGI IRIX, and IBM AIX.
description.platform: Available for Win95, WinNT, AIX 4, Solaris 2.5 and 2.6, and IRIX 6.2 at no charge

description.abstract: Font for typesetting Tolkien Tengwar script, by Michael Urban.
Typesets tensors with dots filling gaps and fine tuning of index placement.
A package which allows the user to set tensor-style super and subscripts with offsets between successive indices.

This package is intended to print a term calendar for use in planning a class. It has a flexible mechanism for specifying which days of the week are to be included and for inserting text either regularly on the same day each week, or on selected days, or for a series of consecutive days. It also has a flexible mechanism for specifing class and nonclass days. Text may be inserted into consecutive days so that it automatically flows around nonclass days.
This distribution is particulalry designed to be very easy to install (20 minutes) and customise with a well organised inputs tree and fast file searching.
A summary of TeX-commands used to create mathematical formulae (and certain other special characters). It can be viewed on any machine that runs OS/2.
TeX to PostScript generic macros and add-ons: transformations of EPS files, prepress preparation, color separation, mirror, etc.

about.name: tex2bib
about.caption: Converts bibitems embedded in a document to bib format.

description.abstract: It should be added as support/tex2bib.
A commercial converter from TeX to html without gifs, using the resident symbol font and very clever HTML code.
Useful for converting plain TeX (AMS) files into AMS-LaTeX and convert plain AMS-TeX bibliographic references into BibTeX.
Translates LaTeX text into RTF (Rich Text Format used by Microsoft Word), into MS-Windows Help RTF, into HTML and into wxHelp. Implemented using the free C plus plus class library wxWindows.
Convert (La)TeX to HTML/XML. A converter from TeX and LaTeX to hypertext (HTML, XML, etc.), providing a configurable (\La)TeX-based authoring system for hypertext.

about.name: tex98
about.caption: The 1998 cycle of changes to TeX from Knuth.

description.abstract: A TeX shell for OS/2, FSS-TeXEdit provides an easy interface for LaTeX2e, dvips, GhostScript and ispell.

about.name: texemplar
about.caption: A class for the journal of CervanTeX.

description.abstract: CervanTeX is the Spanish TeX User's Group.

about.name: texi2www
about.caption: Converts texinfo to display on the Web.

description.abstract: Produces online or printed output from a single source.

about.name: texlist
about.caption: Typeset program (or ASCII text file) listings.

description.abstract: Typeset program (or ASCII text file) listings. This is a C program that generates LaTeX2e.

about.name: texshade
about.caption: Package for setting nucleotide and peptide alignments.

description.abstract: TeXshade is an alignment shading software completely written in TeX/LaTeX which can process multiple sequence alignments in the .MSF and the .ALN file format. It provides in addition to common shading algorithms special shading modes featuring functional aspects, e.g. charge or hydropathy, and a plenitude of commands for handling shading colors, text styles, labels, legends and even allows the user to define completely new sha- ding modes. TeXshade combines highest flexibility and the habitual TeX output quality--with reasonable time expenditure.

about.name: texshell32
about.caption: A free TeXShell for MS-Windows 95 and NT.

description.abstract: Features include: All files kept in own directory (no extra DLLs that mess up your system directory); Syntax highlighting for TeX commands; External programs freely definable; Support for dviwins line specials; Predefined templates and dialogs that assist you in editing text or create new documents; User defined templates that can even embrace an existing text; Dialog for inserting images (works with dviwin only); Images can be opened directly from the texshell; It is small.

about.name: texsis
about.caption: A Plain TeX macro package along the lines of LaTeX.

description.abstract: TeXsis is a Plain TeX macro package which provides useful features for typesetting research papers and related documents. For example, it includes support specifically for: Automatic numbering of equations, figures, tables and references; Simplified control of type sizes, line spacing, footnotes, running headlines and footlines, and tables of contents, figures and tables; Specialized document formats for research papers, preprints and ``e-prints,'' conference proceedings, theses, books, referee reports, letters, and memoranda; Simplified means of constructing an index for a book or thesis; Easy to use double column formatting; Specialized environments for lists, theorems and proofs, centered or non-justified text, and listing computer code; Specialized macros for easily constructing ruled tables. TeXsis was originally developed for physicists, but others may also find it useful. It is completely compatible with Plain TeX.

about.name: texsk
about.caption: Simple LaTeX drawing program for OS/2 PM.

description.abstract: Uses the picture environment.

about.name: text1
about.caption: TeX format from the University of Washington.

description.abstract: \MakeTextUppercase and \MakeTextLowercase are similar to the standard \MakeUppercase and \MakeLowercase, but they do not change the case of any sections of mathematics within the argument.
Supports the Text Companion fonts which provide many text symbols (such as baht, bullet, copyright, musicalnote, onequarter, section, and yen) in the TS1 encoding.
Package to support fitting of text to a given width or height by scaling the font.

about.name: textmerg
about.caption: Merge text in TeX and LaTeX.

description.abstract: Useful, for example, in mail merge.

A small set of utilities for doing documenation in LaTeX intended mainly for programmers. Includes: boxerer.py for creating structured boxes, one inside another so the structure of data and functions can be easily shown; sectioner.py, a front-end filter of LaTeX-modified code, so you can write sections in a relative way; and iarticle.cls, a LaTeX class that allows up to 14 levels of nesting, needed for doing documentation.
A package to facilitate placement of boxes at absolute positions on the LaTeX page, and useful for large-format conference posters, for example.

about.name: tfmpk
about.caption: A viewer for tfm and pk font files.

description.abstract: Enhancements to the theorem environments, giving more choice in theorem layout.
A class for producing a thesis based on the report class for a more European and more flexible look. Supports options like noindent, noitemization, headline, nocenter, crosshair, and chapterbib.
Create animations of 3-dimensional objects (such as polyhedra) in MetaPost.

about.name: threeparttable
about.caption: Tables with captions and notes all the same width.

description.abstract: Can be used to place thumb marks in books, manuals,and reference maunals.

Provides support for thumbnails in pdfTeX using ghostscript to generate the thumbnails which get represented in a TeX readable file that is read by the package thumbpdf.sty to automatically include the thumbnails. Works with both plain TeX and LaTeX.

about.name: tiff2ps
about.caption: A PostScript program for converting TIFF files to EPS.

author.name: Bogulaw Jackowski, Piotr Pianowski, Piotr Strzelczyk

description.abstract: Supports compression (LZW, RLE, Flate) and ASCII85 encoding, and possibly used for generating colour-separated EPS, EPS thumbnails, header EPS containing only a pointer to a source TIFF file.

about.name: time
about.caption: Defines a macro \now to print the current time.

description.abstract: Defines a macro \now to print the current time.
A package to use PostScript Times Roman as the default font.

about.name: timing
about.caption: Fonts and macro package for drawing timing diagrams.

about.name: tipa
about.caption: Fonts and macros for IPA phonetics characters.

about.name: titlefoot
about.caption: Add special material to footer of title page.

description.abstract: Provides the capability of adding keywords (with a \keywords command), a running title (\runningtitle), AMS subject classifications (\amssubj), and an ``authors footnote'' as footnotes to the title or first page of a document. Works with any class for which the \thanks macro works (e.g., article).
Cross-reference titles of sections and floats with caprions just like \ref and \pageref.

about.name: titles
about.caption: Titles of books, articles, etc in LaTeX.

description.abstract: A LaTeX package defining macros that typeset the titles of books, journals, etc. and handle following spacing and punctuation intelligently, based on context. Useful for bibliographic databases and any document. Also includes other markup like \word, \defn, \phrase, etc.

A package providing an interface to sectioning commands for selection from various title styles. E.g., marginal titles and to change the font of all headings with a single command, also providing simple one-step page styles.
A companion for titlesec handling toc/lof/lot entries.

about.name: tkbibtex
about.caption: A portable editor and browser for BibTeX files.

description.abstract: It supports browsing, editing, searching, and annotations.

about.name: tmmath
about.caption: Support for using the Micropress TM-Math fonts.

description.abstract: Support for typesetting math in a style that suits the Adobe Times text fonts. Relies on non-free fonts from Micropress.
A SVGA-lib based DVI-previewer offering xdvi-like anti-aliasing, text-string searching, arbitrary-zooming, bookmarks, some of the hypertex features.
description.platform: linux, gcc, SVGA-lib 1.28 or up, programming language C

description.abstract: Automatically adds the bibliography and/or the index and/or the contents, etc., to the Table of Contents listing.

about.name: tocloft
about.caption: Control table of contents, figures, etc.

description.abstract: Provides control over the typography of the Table of Contents, List of Figures and List of Tables. The package requires the stdclsdv package.

about.name: tocvsec2
about.caption: Section numbering and table of contents control.

description.abstract: Provides control over sectional numbering (without recourse to starred sectional commands) and/or the entries in the Table of Contents on a section by section basis.
Type One Install utiLity which facilitates installation of Adobe fonts for TeX; significantly enhancing the capabilities of the obsolete AFMTOMF program.
Standard LaTeX2e tools, for extended tabular, verbatim and theorem support.

about.name: topcapt
about.caption: Place captions above figures and tables.

description.abstract: Defines a command \topcapt which does the same as caption, except that it places itself correctly when put above the figure/table that it's a caption of.
Automatically adjust spaces between symbols in words or phrases to fit them into a specified length. Any chain of symbols (including spaces) in the current font may be treated.

about.name: trajan
about.caption: Fonts from the Trajan column in Rome in 114 AD.

description.abstract: Provides fonts based on the capitals carved on the Trajan column in Rome in 114 AD. Many typographers think these rank first among the Roman's artistic legacy. The font is uppercase letters together with some punctuation and analphabetics; no lowercase or digits.
Macros for easy transformations of PostScript objects, scaling, rotation, etc.
Tanslates figures generated by xfig to a large variety of formats.
Allows the automatic layout of n-ary trees with arbitrary node sizes in LaTeX, using an external C program to do much of the hard work.

about.name: truncate
about.caption: Truncate text to a specified width.

description.abstract: The tsconfig program tries to make the confguration of the TeXShell by J. Schlegelmilch easier, especially if you have a lot of computers with different processors.
A MS-Windows program which is intended to convert MS-Windows True Type fonts to MetaFont format.
This tool rasterizes the glyph outlines of a TrueType font into a bitmap font in PK format. It is part of the FreeType package.
Extracts the metric and kerning information of a TrueType font and converts it into metric files usable by TeX (quite similar to afm2tfm which is part of the dvips package).

about.name: ttftogf
about.caption: Convert MS-Windows True Type fonts to GF format.

about.name: tth-rpm
about.caption: The TeX to HTML translator for RedHat Linux.

about.name: ttt
about.caption: A Tibetan Transcript Transliterator for LaTeX.

description.abstract: Tables of contents from TUGBoat

about.name: tugboat-toc
about.caption: The complete accumulation of TUGboat tables of contents.

description.abstract: A list of the currently active Technical Working Groups of the TeX User Group.

about.name: twoup
about.caption: Print two virtual pages on each physical page.

description.abstract: The package offers considerable flexibility as to paper size and layout, producing a standard dvi file not involving additional dvi or PostScript filters.
Public domain PostScript fonts, including the URW fonts distributed with Ghostscript.

A package that removes the restriction when using scalable versions of the cm fonts ( Bakoma, or versions from BSR/Y&Y, or True Type versions from Kinch, PCTeX, etc.) where LaTeX restricts the cm fonts to discrete sizes.
Can handle almost all of HTML2, and most of the math fragment of the draft HTML3.
Creates a type specimen page with useful information about the typeface.

This package provides a LaTeX2e document class named `ua-thesis' for typesetting theses and dissertations in the official format required by the University of Arizona. Moreover, there is a fully compatible alternative document class `my-thesis' for private ``nice'' copies of the dissertation, and the respective title pages are available as separate packages to work with ``any'' document class.
A modified version of the standard LaTeX report style that is accepted for use with University of California PhD dissertations and Masters theses.
This replaces the earlier version of 1992, by adding a short list of hyphenation exceptions. The actual patterns themselves are unchanged.
Be advised that underlining is considered bad style in typesetting.
An interface to inputenc for using alternate input encodings.

about.name: uncial
about.caption: Fonts based on the Uncial manuscript book-hand used between the 3rd and 6th century AD.

description.abstract: The uncial and alluncl packages provide Metafont fonts based on the Uncial manuscript book-hand used between the 3rd and 6th century AD. The font consists of minuscules and digits, with some appropriate period punctuation marks. Both normal and bold versions are provided. This is one in a series of manuscript fonts.
Be advised that underlining is considered bad style in typesetting. See also ulem which is a specific package for LaTeX.
Make ``_'' print as \textunderscore in text.
An implementation of the universal font by Herbert Bayer of the Bauhaus school for MetaFont. It is supported in LaTeX with a package and font definition file.

Check filesystem tree (or union of several trees) for unique leaf names; useful for spotting ambiguities that path-searching programs could trip over. For each non-unique leaf name found, it prints out ``ls'' and ``md5'' information for each candidate file.
Includes two packages for typesetting fractions and physical units.
An implemnatation of Herbert Bayers `universal' font, with LaTeX support.

A form of \verb that allows linebreaks at certain characters or combinations of characters, accepts reconfiguration, and can usually be used in the argument to another command. It is intended for email addresses, hypertext links, directories/paths, etc., which normally have no spaces.
Font metrics, and macro support in LaTeX2e, for free URW fonts.

A collection of virtual fonts generated with fontinst 1.6, that provide the fonts which URW has made available under the GNU License: Antiqua, Grotesk, Nimbus and Nimbus Sans, (and which are available as raw fonts urw) in OT1, T1, 8r and OT4 encodings, to be used with LaTeX2e.
A version of bachref which adds to bibliography entries an entry saying where this particular reference was cited.
A LaTeX2e thesis class definition for University of Toronto.
LaTeX package for preparation of a thesis that meets the requirements of the Graduate School of the University of TeXas at Austin.
Macros for more convenient representation of vectors in LaTeX2e, both symbolically and as implicit or explicit rows/columns of elements.

about.name: vertex
about.caption: Styles for economics working papers and journals.

description.abstract: A system to support the writers of virtual fonts; this is written in Turbo Pascal, and sources are included.
A set of scripts and Perl files which aim to make the installation of families of PostScript fonts and creation of necessary virtual fonts outline fonts `virtually' automatic. Uses fontinst.
An article-like document class which is 7pt rather then 10pt.
This class provides necessary macros to prepare your Curriculum Vitae or Resume.
Provides a macro to set various margins as well as dimensions for header/footer and page dimensions. Most common paper sizes and two sided printing are supported.

about.name: vncmr
about.caption: A Vietnamese extension of the cmr fonts.

description.abstract: Contains MetaFont source files, tfm files, and various LaTeX2e and plain TeX files for VISCII encoding.
Defines a command which produces a version number in the dvi-file when LaTeX is run.
A package for adding a vertical numbering to the general text so that the text can be properly referenced. The vertical ruler can be scaled and moved freely. Supports LaTeX and plain TeX.

Defines a tabular column type for formatting numerical columns in LaTeX. The column type enables numerical items to be right justified relative to each other, while centred beneath the column label. In addition, macros are provided to enable variations on this column type to be defined. Usage of the package is superficially similar to that of dcolumn; however, the alignment scheme is different, and the packages have different, though overlapping, applications.
Converted (PostScript) outlines of the wasy fonts.
The wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts).
Converted (PostScript) outlines of the wasy fonts.
The wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts).

about.name: wasysym
about.caption: Extra characters from the Waldis symbol fonts.

description.abstract: Makes some additional characters available that come from the wasy fonts (Waldis symbol fonts). These fonts are not automatically included in NFSS2/LaTeX2e since they take up important space and often aren't necessary if one makes use of the packages amsfonts or amssymb. Symbols include: join box, diamond, leadsto, sqsubset, lhd, rhd, apple, ocircle invneg, logof, varint, male, female, phone, clock lightning, pointer, sun, bell, permil, smiley, various electrical symbols, shapes, music notes, circles, signs, astronomy, etc.
Web2c for MS-Windows32, including a complete collection of TeX related executables.

about.name: web2c
about.caption: The ``standard'' source C version of the TeX sysmtem.

description.abstract: Uses the GNU autconfig package to compile and install effortlessly. Simply ./configure; make; make install.
An installation-guide for a complete TeX-System consisting of MiKTeX, WinEdt and GhostView.

about.name: winedt
about.caption: MS-Windows95 shell and editor for TeX.

description.abstract: A full-featured text editor and Shell for MS-Windows95 (and MS-Windows NT or MS-Windows 3.x), allowing the editting of large, multiple, text files in the usual MS-Windows95 way, using a Multiple Documents Interface (MDI) and following or extending the MS-Windows' Standards in every respect, and supporting (LaTeX) Syntax Highlighting and Input/Output ASCII Code Translation Tables with a comprehensive context-sensitive Help.
A full emTeX distribution for MS-Windows98 including GhostScript and WinEdit and preconfigured to work with TeX.

about.name: winshell
about.caption: A MS-Windows32 user interface for TeX.

description.abstract: It is not a TeX-system---you need an additional TeX package for DOS/MS-Windows (e.g., miktex and web2c-win32). For previewing documents you will need something like GhostScript or dviwin.

A program to simplify MS-Windows Metafile Graphics (WMF) containing either vector-images or bitmaps into Encapsulated PostScript format having tight bounding-boxes (WinNT and Win95) at exactly the same size as the WMF-originals.
MetaFont fonts for Old English, Indic languages in transcription, and American Indian languages.
Fonts (MetaFont) and support for Tamil, created at the University of Washington.
A word 6 to anything converter, currently supporting output formats in text and LaTeX.
A list (in HTML format) of packages for converting between LaTeX and TeX documents and a variety of other formats including RTF, Word, and Wordperfect.

about.name: wrapfig
about.caption: Produces figures which text can flow around.

description.abstract: Does not work in combination with list environments, but can be used in a parbox or minipage, and in twocolumn format.

about.name: wsuipa
about.caption: Style for using International Phonetic Alphabet fonts.

description.abstract: A flexible, 32-bit MS-Windows-TeX-editor with Highlight-O-Matic syntax-highlighting.

about.name: xarticle
about.caption: A class that allows use of 7pt, 8pt and 9pt style options.

description.abstract: Not fully compatible with article class though.

about.name: xcomment
about.caption: Allows selected environments to be included/excluded.

about.name: xdvi
about.caption: A dvi previewer for the X Window System.

description.abstract: A (now standard) variant of xdvi with recursive searching for font files in subdirectories.

A menu-driven tool that allows the user to draw and manipulate objects interactively in an X window. Generates pictures for PostScript and a variety of other formats (e.g. for inclusion in LaTeX documents).

about.name: xspace
about.caption: Define commands that don't eat spaces.

description.abstract: An extended version of supertabular to automatically break tables accross pages.

about.name: xtem
about.caption: An X11 TeX menu built on Tcl/Tk.

description.abstract: It provides a simple and comfortable graphical user interface to control file and directory selection, directory creation, vi, emacs, TeX, LaTeX, previewing, etc.

A package for typesetting a variety of graphs and diagrams with TeX. Xy-pic works with most formats (including LaTeX, AMS-LaTeX, AMS-TeX, and plain TeX), in particular Xy-pic is provided as a LaTeX2e `supported package'.
A LaTeX interface to the old-german fonts designed by Yannis Haralambous: Gotisch, Schwabacher, Fraktur and the baroque initials.
Package to provide support in LaTeX for writing all standardized Yi characters. Yi (also known as Lolo) is spoken in Southern China; the script is syllabic, based on an older, ideographic system.
A special font (yinit) is defined to be used for initial dropped capitals.
Prints two six-monthly vertrical-type daily planner (i.e., months along the top, days downwards), with each 6-month period fitting onto a single A4 (or US letter) sheet. Updated annually.

about.name: zed-csp
about.caption: Typesetting Z and CSP format specifications.

description.abstract: Virtual T1 encoded Computer Modern fonts based on (OT1) Computer Modern, Times, and Helvetica fonts, intended to simulate `dc' fonts. (Wayne Sullivan's `dm' fonts are another approach to the substitution of `dc' fonts by virtual ones.)
